chargeHist.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury
Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald J Neal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca AMENDED FROM Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Battery AMENDED FROM Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery AMENDED FROM Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  All other court costs are waived.

May be served in WPS.
Consecutive to: Current sentence

Katie Gutowski
Preliminary hearing on March 19, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Donald J Neal in court with attorney Margaret Marie Johnson.  Defendant Donald J Neal in custody.  James D. Newlun appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 19, 2014 at 09:00 am.
